title: Building Permits
description: A. SUMMARY The dataset includes details of all building permit applications filed with the Department of Building Inspection. Permit numbers and associated information may be repeated in multiple rows if there are multiple addresses associated with the permit. To view the deduplicated building permits dataset with just the primary address, click here. Data is uploaded nightly by DBI. Users can view associated addenda, routing, and inspection information for each permit in the dataset online through DBI’s Permit Tracking System here. A full data dictionary for this dataset is available by clicking here. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED The dataset is created by extracting permit characteristics and key dates (including permit filing, issuance, and completion dates) from DBI’s Permit Tracking System. C. UPDATE PROCESS The process that builds this dataset will run nightly and include all permits entered into the system up to the time of the refresh (see the “data as of” column in the dataset). D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Users can use this dataset to search for all permits associated with a specific address or parcel number and view characteristics like addresses, permit descriptions of work, unit counts, valuations, etc. If the analytical objective is to measure permitting trends for all addresses, we recommend using the primary address building permits dataset. Note: if you need to open this dataset in Excel, use one of the pre-filtered datasets. Opening the main dataset in Excel will cause some data to be lost as there are more than one million rows in the full dataset. 1. Building Permits filed on or after January 1, 2013 2. Building Permits filed before January 1, 2013 E. RELATED DATASETS Department of Building Inspections Permits Data Building Permits (Unique) Building Permit Addenda with Routing Building Permits Contacts Electrical Permits Plumbing Permits Boiler Permits Dwelling Unit Completion Counts by Building Permit Planning Department Permits Planning Department Permits Public Works Construction Permits Department of Public Works Street Use Permits Department of Public Works Large Utility Excavation Permits Fire Department Permits Fire Department Permits Other housing/ construction related datasets related to building permits Planning Department Housing Development Pipeline Quarterly datasets Mayor’s Office of Housing and Community Development: Affordable Housing Pipeline Affordable Housing Pipeline For even more permit datasets, click this link and search “Permits.”

columns.name: Permit Number
columns.description: Permit Number. Permits that start with 'M' are miscellaneous permits for this like street use or address creation.

columns.name: Permit Type
columns.description: Type of permit (i.e. Permit Application Form number)

columns.name: Permit Type Definition
columns.description: Definition of each permit type

columns.name: Permit Creation Date
columns.description: Date that application is created in permit tracking system.

columns.name: Block
columns.description: Block

columns.name: Lot
columns.description: Lot

columns.name: Street Number
columns.description: Street Number

columns.name: Street Number Suffix
columns.description: Street Number Suffix

columns.name: Street Name
columns.description: Street Name

columns.name: Street Suffix
columns.description: Street Suffix

columns.name: Unit
columns.description: Unit

columns.name: Unit Suffix
columns.description: Unit Suffix

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Description of permit scope of work

columns.name: Current Status
columns.description: Current Status. Note: this column should be in combination with the Approved, Issued, Completed dates.

columns.name: Current Status Date
columns.description: Current Status Date

columns.name: Filed Date
columns.description: Date permit was filed in permit tracking system

columns.name: Issued Date
columns.description: Date permit was issued (i.e. permit fees paid)

columns.name: Completed Date
columns.description: Date that completed work was finaled by inspection staff

columns.name: First Construction Document Date
columns.description: For site permits, this is the date when the addenda marked as the first construction document (usually the first addenda) is issued.

columns.name: Structural Notification
columns.description: Structural Notification

columns.name: Number of Existing Stories
columns.description: Number of Existing Stories

columns.name: Number of Proposed Stories
columns.description: Number of Proposed Stories

columns.name: Voluntary Soft-Story Retrofit
columns.description: Voluntary Soft-Story Retrofit

columns.name: Fire Only Permit
columns.description: Fire Only Permit - i.e. permits where SFFD is is the only reviewing agency.

columns.name: Estimated Cost
columns.description: Estimated project cost

columns.name: Revised Cost
columns.description: Revised project cost after project review

columns.name: Existing Use
columns.description: Existing Use

columns.name: Existing Units
columns.description: Existing number of units on site

columns.name: Proposed Use
columns.description: Proposed use

columns.name: Proposed Units
columns.description: Proposed number of units on site (after construction)

columns.name: Plansets
columns.description: Number of plan copies/ "plansets" submitted with application)

columns.name: TIDF Compliance
columns.description: Permit is required to pay the Transit Impact Development Fee. This fee is based on the square footage of commercial space being developed.

columns.name: Existing Occupancy
columns.description: Existing building occupancy code or codes

columns.name: Proposed Occupancy
columns.description: Proposed building occupancy code or codes

columns.name: Existing Construction Type
columns.description: Existing Construction Type. See full definitions here: https://sf.gov/information/building-construction-type-definitions

columns.name: Existing Construction Type Description
columns.description: Existing Construction Type description. See full definitions here: https://sf.gov/information/building-construction-type-definitions

columns.name: Proposed Construction Type
columns.description: Proposed Construction Type. See full definitions here: https://sf.gov/information/building-construction-type-definitions

columns.name: Proposed Construction Type Description
columns.description: Proposed Construction Type description. See full definitions here: https://sf.gov/information/building-construction-type-definitions

columns.name: Site Permit
columns.description: Site Permit

columns.name: Last Permit Activity Date
columns.description: Date of most recent activity on permit (or associated addenda for site permits) at any routing station.

columns.name: Application Submission Method
columns.description: Indicates how the permit application was submitted to DBI, i.e. via DBI's permit web application form, SF.gov form, or in person. (Auto-generated by MIS based on other PTS data fields)

columns.name: ADU
columns.description: Permit for an accessory dwelling unit (ADU)

columns.name: Primary Address Flag
columns.description: Indicates whether the address for the permit is the primary address identified by DBI

columns.name: Supervisor District
columns.description: Supervisor district the permit falls within

columns.name: Neighborhoods - Analysis Boundaries
columns.description: Analysis neighborhood the permit falls within

columns.name: Zipcode
columns.description: Zip code the permit falls within

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The latitude and longitude associated with the permit (based on block and lot, i.e. APN)

columns.name: Point Source
columns.description: Data source for the coordinate point data, i.e. parcel centroid or EAS Address point.

columns.name: Record ID
columns.description: Unique ID created from concatenating P_ADDR_ID & AVS_ADDRESSES_ID

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was last updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was was last updated/ loaded into DataSF data portal

columns.name: SF Find Neighborhoods 2
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'SF Find Neighborhoods' (6qbp-sg9q) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
